results.title: Chiapas Army Base occupation (Mexico) Jan 1, 2001
results.brief_description: This astounding testimony to ‘the power of the people’ was given to the Memory Grid Community Collection as part of the SKA TV video compile ‘Global Insights 4’, a collection of shorts from around the world with a focus on grass-roots peoples’ action. Chiapas Army Base (Mexico) was filmed by Big Noise Tactical (USA) a not-for-profit, all-volunteer collective of media-makers around the world, ‘dedicated to circulating beautiful, passionate, revolutionary images.’

results.title: The Milgram reenactment
results.brief_description: In 1961 at Yale University one of the most famous learning experiments in the history of psychology shocked the world.The experiment was an eloquent and sophisticated piece of artifice aimed at convincing the subjects (Milgram named them Teachers) that they really were administering extreme shocks to an unwilling victim. The disturbing results shown that in the context of following orders we are capable of unquestioningly causing the suffering of others. UK conceptual Artist Rod Dickinson in his work has precisely recreated the extraordinary drama that occurred and the troubling questions that it raises about humanity.

results.title: Fluid
results.brief_description: Fluid is an abstract, miniature ecosystem made up of a handful of different species of organisms who live inside the computer screen. Fluid is also a game about systems, digital aesthetics and green ethics. The final objective of the game cleaning up the ecosystem!
results.description: Fluid is an abstract, miniature ecosystem made up of a handful of different species of organisms who live inside the computer screen. Fluid is also a game about systems, digital aesthetics and green ethics. The final objective of the game cleaning up the ecosystem!

results.title: Neighbours (the remix) - DAMP (Full potato jacket)
results.brief_description: The scene is familiar. A scene you know well. A buffet setting of multinational brands adorns a beautifully set table. Products which for years you have been told you want; you need. The camera pans the table. You recognise everything. So what happens when the desirable turns undesirable? Melbourne art collective DAMP wage war on themselves in a gluttonous, misappropriation of food. A food fight of excessive proportions aims to subvert the subliminal desire global advertising has imposed, via mass media, on mainstream Australia.

results.title: Neighbours (the remix) - Destiny Deacon (Over d-Fence)
results.brief_description: A half-hour program that references the global success of the soap-opera Neighbours. Consisting of three nine-minute segments by an emerging documentarian, an emerging fiction moving image maker, and by a visual artist, Neighbours (the remix) will playfully subvert and imaginatively redraw the landscape of Australia suburbia. As part of Neighbours (the remix) there will be interspersed ad-breaks (30 second duration each) by five leading, established art practitioners.

results.title: Memo
results.creator_credit: Matthew Riley, David Atkinson and Jeremy Parker
results.brief_description:
One of 6 works selected by AIM director David Atkinson as representing the best interactive work produced by the AIM centre up until 2004. Memo is a journal-like collection of imagery, text and observations that looks at the permeation of the mediascape, technology and popular culture with the everyday. Intrigued by how this convergence shapes and influence what we perceive as self, experience, memory and identity I have examined and re-presented visual and verbal material derived from daily life-sounds, samples, imagery, text and language.
A subtle and very beautiful piece of interactive design and visual patina. Selected for exhibition at MILIA’s “New Talent Pavilion” 2001, Cannes, France.

results.title: The Effects of fire
results.brief_description: This proposed public imaging piece shows a series of close up portraits of domestic objects being burnt to abstraction, creating an inventory of domestic combustion in this piece. Punctuated with subtle yet deliberate, almost mechanised camera moves and cut in a very subdued fashion, this piece will be predominantly shot with a macro lens and will also be given a highly colour saturated visual treatment in post production.

results.title: The Shadowers
results.brief_description: This three screen video installation creates a series of disquieting tableaus that present visions of three characters engaged in a game like narrative and whose roles and identities shift and blur between attacker and victim and all that could be the same in between. In an articulation of a ‘schizophrenic understanding of the self’ Tichacek presents an image of oscillating inner world’s where physical and mental experience fluctuate and escape simple definition in the parameters of physical and emotional manipulations and violence (Exhibition proposal). In a thematic echo of and engagement with technological advancements in bodily modification, the victim, played by the artist, is submitted to a range of intrusive and physical molding actions at the hands of the other characters, set in lush outdoor settings as well as in a dark and clinical interior. Suspended in a triangular fashion and surrounding a sculptural object, the viewer can move between and behind the synchronised screens, the physical and psychological shifts of identity featured in the video mirrored in the viewer’s own fluctuating experience of the work as they become variously immersed in or distanced from the disturbingly beautiful and new but fragile ‘prosthetic’ space the game narrative articulates. Static and inarticulate frequencies, or white noise, layer the visuals in place of the characters’ speech and screams and create an aural sense of distortion and displacement for the viewer in the use of surround sound.
